intro: Calandrinia columbiana, commonly known as the desert purslane, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and vibrant yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Calandrinia columbiana is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a resilient species in harsh desert conditions.
